intro: Matelea aspera, commonly known as the rough matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent, spurred corona. Matelea aspera is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
